Detailed Description

Allows to set and get the active language for the system. The language manager also assures a proper translation of strings.

Member Function Documentation

static INT LanguageManager::GetActiveLanguage (   )  [inline, static]
 

Returns the ID of the current set language. It is recommended that the applications work with the LanguageManager::LanguageType instead of language IDs (see LanguageManager::SetActiveLanguageType() and LanguageManager::GetActiveLanguageType()).

LanguageManager::LanguageType LanguageManager::GetActiveLanguageType (   )  [static]
 

Returns the language type of the current set language. Note that LocaleConfig::GetLanguageType() must be customized, which maps the language IDs to the language type (the class LocaleConfig is in the Config directory of the project).

const WCHAR * LanguageManager::GetString (  INT  index  )  [static]
 

Obsolete - Returns the string with the index index of the current set language table.

static BOOLEAN LanguageManager::HasActiveLanguageChanged (   )  [inline, static]
 

Returns TRUE, if the active language has been changed after the booting process. If FALSE is returned some internal optimizations are possible, as retranslating strings is a quite expensive operation.

INT LanguageManager::MapIso639 (  const WCHAR *  code  )  [static]
 

Maps the language code defined in ISO-639 to the internal language ID. If no language ID is available for the given code, -1 is returned.

const WCHAR * LanguageManager::ReTranslate (  const WCHAR *  text  )  [static]
 

Retranslates the translated text text to the text dependand on the current set language. If text is not part of the language-table or no language table is provided, text itself is returned.

Parameters:
text Pointer to the already translated text.
Returns:
Pointer to the retranslated text.

void LanguageManager::SetActiveLanguage (  INT  lang_id  )  [static]
 

Sets the language to lang_id. The maximum numbers of available languages are defined by LocaleConfig::GetLanguageCount (the class LocaleConfig is in the Config directory of the project). All windows get the message LanguageChangedMsg, which can be treated with the method Component::OnLanguageChanged(). Additionally an update to all themes is done, because a theme may change it's font dynamically by the method ThemeConfig::GetFontId().

It is recommended that the applications work with the LanguageManager::LanguageType instead of language IDs (see LanguageManager::SetActiveLanguageType() and LanguageManager::GetActiveLanguageType()).

void LanguageManager::SetActiveLanguageType (  LanguageType  lang_type  )  [static]
 

Sets the language to lang_type. All windows get the message LanguageChangedMsg, which can be treated with the method Component::OnLanguageChanged(). Additionally an update to all themes is done, because a theme may change it's font dynamically by the method ThemeConfig::GetFontId().

Note that LocaleConfig::GetLanguageType() must be customized, which maps the language IDs to the language type (the class LocaleConfig is in the Config directory of the project).

const WCHAR * LanguageManager::Translate (  const WCHAR *  text,
INT  ambiguous_hint = -1
)  [static]
 

Translates the non-translated text text and returns the corresponding text dependend on the current set language. If no language table is provided, text itself is returned.

Parameters:
text Pointer to the text which should be translated.
ambiguous_hint It is possible that one text may have different translations in different contexts. ambiguous_hint indicates the index of the context starting with zero. The default value is -1, which means that there is a 1 to 1 relation between the text and it's translations.
Returns:
Pointer to translated text.
